oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of a soldier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Studio portrait of a man wearing a military uniform and kepi. The kepi bears the infantry insignia adopted in 1875 and indicaties Co. B, 1st Regt. This sepia photograph is an example of a cabinet card. Such cabinet cards were popular in the United States between 1870 and 1910. The photographers, Marceau & Bellsmith, operated a studio in Cincinnati from 1887 to 1890.
